intro: Celmisia tomentella, commonly known as the silver celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is part of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding delicate beauty to its habitat. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Celmisia tomentella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
